title: Pilot
description: Ponch and Jon take to their bikes to bust an auto theft ring that employs a clever means of smuggling hot sports cars past the Highway Patrol. Ponch's probation is almost over when he runs into a sticky situation.

title: Undertow
description: Ponch and Jon track down a tow truck driver who robs stranded single women motorists. Ponch's exposure to a leaky tank of nitrous oxide (laughing gas) threatens his performance on the streets as well as in the CHP's big basketball game.

title: Dog Gone
description: It's puppy love at the Highway Patrol when Ponch and Jon conspire to keep a dog they rescued a secret from Sgt. Getraer. A young punk and his pals plot to sabotage Ponch's bike, but make a big mistake.

title: Moving Violation
description: Ponch and Jon track a stolen bus and deal with a mad driver who begins to take his car apart after receiving a ticket for speeding.

title: Career Day
description: Ponch is asked to appear at his old high school's Career Day and Jon helps him entertain the audience.

title: Baby Food
description: The CHP investigate a shipment of baby food that spilled from a truck and is contaminated with botulism.

title: Taking Its Toll
description: The CHP investigate a series of thefts by bandits at a toll booth.

title: Green Thumb Burglar
description: Ponch and Jon track down two thieves who have been stealing shrubs.

title: Hustle
description: The officers investigate some motorcycle-riding thieves, while Ponch convinces Jon to join a CHP bowling tournament.

title: Highway Robbery
description: A motorcyclist robbing people turns out to be Jon's old football teammate.

title: Name Your Price
description: Ponch is picked as a contestant for the game show "Name Your Price."

title: Aweigh We Go
description: While assigned to duty at a weigh station, Ponch and Jon go after a hijacked truck.

title: One Two Many
description: Complaints come into headquarters about Jon when a fake CHP officer resembling him causes problems along the highway during traffic stops.

title: Rustling
description: The CHP investigate a group of cattle rustlers trying to cheat insurance companies.

title: Surf's Up
description: Ponch and Jon are transferred to Malibu Beach and must deal with a teenager who has a grudge against the police.

title: Vintage '54
description: Ponch and Jon help reunite a baby with the family who left the little one behind following the confusion of packing for a vacation.

title: Hitch-Hiking Hitch
description: Ponch and Jon get involved with a pair of hitchhikers.

title: Cry Wolf
description: CHP officers try to catch the person calling in fake accidents.

title: Crash Diet
description: The CHP officers try to reach a 1,000-pound weight loss goal, while investigating reports of a man throwing dirt at traffic.

title: Rainy Day
description: The CHP officers are assigned to cars and investigate a moving casino.

title: Crack-Up
description: When Jon is sidelined with an injury, Ponch is partnered with Sgt. Getraer. A reckless tow truck driver with a grudge against CHPs endangers the entire department.

title: Flashback!
description: A biker gang is stealing CHP motorcycles. When a pompous new patrolman joins the CHP, Jon flashes back to his first meetings with a hot-dogging dirt biker named Frank Poncherello.

title: Peaks and Valleys
description: An accident victim Ponch and Jon helped is pressed by his lawyer into suing them. Ponch encourages his partner to stay on the force when a disillusioned Jon considers leaving the CHP to sell used cars for a successful high school friend.

title: The Volunteers
description: Ponch and Jon are tapped to escort a convoy of tanker trucks containing highly explosive and toxic chlorine gas across 140 miles of troublesome terrain.

title: Family Crisis
description: Ponch intervenes when he suspects Jon's young nephew of joyriding in stolen cars. An overeager officer is obsessed with recovering a stolen movie stunt car being employed for diamond heists. Ponch trades in his motor home for an apartment.

title: Disaster Squad
description: Ponch befriends a runaway four-year-old motorcycle enthusiast while Jon romances his divorcée mother. A sensationalist news crew dubbed the Disaster Squad pesters Ponch and Jon.

title: Neighborhood Watch
description: Ponch and Jon are put on patrol in a residential neighborhood where four unsupervised children run amok. Jon has repeated run-ins with a reckless driver with a bad attitude.

title: Trick or Trick
description: Keeping the streets safe for trick-or-treaters, Ponch and Jon search a haunted house for a runaway boy, foil a ghoulish getaway and nab a candy bag snatcher. Meanwhile, Sgt. Getraer is determined to bust the Halloween Hobgoblin.

title: High Flyer
description: Ponch and Jon pick up the trail of an auto theft ring. A fatherless teenage girl has a crush on Jon. Ponch is running out of excuses to avoid going up on patrol in the CHP helicopter.

title: The Grudge
description: In retaliation for a drug bust, five frat boys wage psychological and prank warfare on Ponch and Jon.

title: The Sheik
description: It's the "Taming of the Sheik" when Ponch and Jon are put on patrol with a pompous and spoiled young oil sheik studying police science in America.

title: Return of the Turks
description: Ponch and Jon each experience unsettling encounters with past acquaintances. A reckless driver plays bumper cars on the freeway.

title: Supercycle
description: An Evel Knievel-style stunt cyclist evades, outwits and embarrasses the CHP, so Harlan develops a supercycle to put Ponch on a level playing field.

title: High Explosive
description: Ponch and Jon befriend a fatherless country boy out of place in the big city and in big trouble for firing his pellet gun into traffic. A reckless ambulance driver threatens lives when he illegally transports cases of unstable dynamite.

title: Down Time
description: Ponch's personal and professional lives meet when his prized Firebird is heisted by a trio of beautiful car thieves. Determined to get it back, Ponch turns detective on his down time.

title: Repo Man
description: Jon's heroism makes him a reluctant local celebrity. A disreputable repo man makes life difficult for Ponch and Jon. The CHPs pull a practical joke on their published writer colleague Grossman.

title: Mait Team
description: Cahill is critically injured in a multi-vehicle pile-up that claims eleven lives. Ponch and Jon are tapped to serve on the Multidisciplinary Accident Investigation Team determined to pinpoint the cause and to clear Cahill from blame.

title: Pressure Point
description: Ponch and Jon put away their bikes and play a diplomat and his chauffeur when they go undercover to prevent a wealthy man and his beautiful granddaughter from falling victim to a violent extortion racket.

title: The Matchmakers
description: Jon and Ponch are matchmakers for two lonely people: an officer forced to retire and a widow pressured by the city to move.

title: Rally 'Round the Bank
description: While investigating a string of drive-in-bank robberies, Ponch is baffled by a visit from his mother.

title: Quarantine
description: A young hitchhiker with a bomb succumbs to a rare illness after being taken into custody by Jon and Ponch, putting the CHP headquarters on a quarantine alert.

title: CHP-BMX
description: Distracted by his son's accident, Sgt. Getraer mistakenly releases a narcotics suspect.

title: Ride the Whirlwind
description: Jon and Ponch encounter unruly dirt bikers, a clandestine PCP operation and a macho city councilman showing off on the hillsides when they volunteer as members of a pilot trail bike team.

title: The Greatest Adventures of CHiPs
description: While Ponch and Jon are off in Sacramento attending a seminar, Grossman starts to collect anecdotes about the team from other officers so that - win or lose - they can give them a party, half testimonial and half roast.

title: Return of the Supercycle
description: Ponch and Jon are chasing someone who looks like the daredevil motorcyclist they encountered last year. Ponch is injured. Jon goes to see Roy Yarnell, the daredevil but he claims, it's not him. That's when Jon asks Getraer to let him use the super cycle which they used to catch him but he won't let him.

title: The Great 5K Star Race and Boulder Wrap Party: Part 1
The Great 5K Star Race and Boulder Wrap Party: Part 2
The Hawk and the Hunter
description: Barizca's father a crop duster is being threatened by someone who believes that what he is using is dangerous. When Barizca also learns that his father who is not physically able to fly, he decides to take some time off to fill in for him. While Jon tries to find the man threatening Barizca, he tries to get them (father and son) to talk; because Barizca will have to make a choice if whether or not he will stay with the CHP.

title: Vigilante
description: A criminal whom Getraer arrested is back and is terrorizing his family. At the same time a newly formed watch group tries to help by calling the cops when they come across a crime. But one of the members who lost a family member takes things too far.

title: A Simple Operation
description: When Getraer is injured he is brought to the hospital. While there and under sedation he sees someone do something to the man in the room with him. While trying to find out who the perpetrator is, the man tries to take Getraer out.

title: Vagabonds
description: A family of con artists are operating in the area. Jon and Ponch meet the son of one of them before they knew of them. At the same time the mother of the son wants her husband to go straight but his brother won't let him.

title: The Killer Indy
description: The CHP is looking for a biker gang who goes around racing in the streets and who were also responsible for an accident. New CHP officer Steve McCleish thinks that the gang is trying to emulate something McCleish calls an Indy which is a motorcycle race. And it turns out his brother Toro's considered to be the best at it. And the leader is challenging him. And it turns out that his other brother, Ted hangs with the gang.

title: Anything But the Truth
description: Jon's new girlfriend, is a hitchhiker and tells all sorts of tales to get rides. And when the person who gives her a ride commits a crime in front of her. So when they find out about her, she is not a credible witness.

title: Bright Flashes
description: Someone is committing robberies using a laser to blind anyone who stands in their way even cops. A former western star whom Jon idolizes was at the robbery and is hesitant to come forward because he did nothing.

title: Force Seven
description: Jon and Ponch pull over a man for speeding. This is brought to the attention of an LAPD unit called Force Seven wherein all members are experts in martial arts. And a cocky cop who is also a martial arts expert, is reassigned to the unit. And his do it his way attitude jeopardizes them finding the man. It seems that he is a missile engineer and apparently he is working for someone who wants him to arm one. And eventually they discover that the one who hired him is an old enemy of the unit's leader.

title: The Spaceman Made Me Do It
Rock Devil Rock
description: Ponch and Bobby meet a goth rock star. He later tells them he fears that he is cursed. That he's going to die.

title: Something Special
description: A man who worked in an auto plant but was laid off when imported cars were preferred takes his frustrations out on all imported cars. Ponch has been working at the Special Olympics and the boy he's working with is sad that his father doesn't seem to show any interest. So Ponch goes to see him and when he says something hurtful, his son runs away. And a friend of Bobby's who's a motorcycle daredevil is about to try and dangerous stunt.

title: Day of the Robot
description: A robot is visiting the CHP to show that it could be helpful to their work and so far it does but for some reason every time he goes near something electrical it shorts out. Ponch is dealing with a couple of girls who go around on bikes and pursuing anyone who is speeding. He suspects that one of them has a personal reason for what she is doing.

title: Hot Date
description: Ponch goes home to meet his girlfriend. But when he gets there, two men grab him and hold him at gun point. One of the men is someone he and Bobby busted now he wants to get back at both of them. So he tells Ponch to call Bobby to come over but Ponch refuses until his girlfriend arrives.

title: High Times
description: While trying to find some car thieves, the team gets a lead that takes them to a local high school. Ponch knows the shop teacher at the school, a car thief, whom he busted and who's on parole. Ponch goes to see him and asks him to keep his eyes open but the guy thinks that Ponch is singling him out. They send Bruce to the school, undercover and gets close to a girl who knows the ones they're looking for.

roles.char: Parkdale H.S. Shop Teacher John Casey

title: Things That Go Creep in the Night
